intro: Lepidosperma rottboellii, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sedgeland sedge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. This perennial herb typically grows in wetland and swampy environments, often forming dense stands. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, spike-like clusters of flowers. The plant plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
